column4: I'm still looking for suggestions on a small low power box for a web server
then definately give the fit-pc 1.0 a look.  fit-pc.com
that isn't much of a percentage decline
ya sure - you were being a clown I think
have a peak at the HP netbook 1000MI  ($387 starting price I hear)
that little fit-PC sure looks interesting.  I wonder about a solid state HDD?
yeah, it'll support a ssd or a compact flash via adapter
I want something relaiable of course - I expect these are... also how many NICS if I want to use as a firewall?
i've been using a couple as routers/firewalls for a couple years
I use pfsense on them.. it's insanely great :)
not bad - the webservers I currently ahve are very reliable... and they help heat my house so I can save on my gas bill
I'm going to cehck out OpenBSD for the firewalling
that's what pfsense is based on... check it out for sure.
you can run virtual box on many os's including windows and ubuntu
